title: Career Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Vista College (College Station, TX) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I went through 2 phone screenings and 3 separate interviews with 3 different people virtually and in person.   Then they processed a background check and offered me the position.  The interview process took about one week to complete.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple projects at once?

title: Instructor (Adjunct) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vista College
Interview Descriptions: Simple. Fast. Had to do a teaching presentation during the interview and skills assessed. But all in all, easy process. Interview questions are basic, could be a little in-depth though.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Adjunct Medical Assistant Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vista College (El Paso, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: You send your resume, human resources calls you and they give you a short interview. Then they did a background check that lasted almost 2 weeks and was what delayed the process the most.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to teach

title: Office Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vista College (Las Cruces, NM) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Had to wait for the interview  they were not ready for the interview. he had made several appointment for the same time. and when i went in the was not questions about if i was qualified it was more if i was interested in coming back to school.
Interview Questions: tried to sale me the school and talk me into coming back to school wasn't  an interview really they look at it as a business opportunity

title: Instructor, College Or University Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vista College
Interview Descriptions: There was a brief, cursory interview by an interviewer who made it clear they just needed a warm body to stand in front of the class for a few weeks. The interview literally only lasted about five minutes.  I was hired on the spot and was handed a huge stack of paperwork to make it official.
Interview Questions: Do you have any formal teaching experience? Informal?

title: Marketing Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vista College in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received an initial screening call from a recruiter a week or two later. She then scheduled a longer phone interview between the two of us which went well. A week later I interviewed with an outside consultant who was helping them fill the position. This too was a phone call that went well; it lasted a little over an hour.

A couple weeks passed with no feedback. I followed up and was asked to come in later that week for a series of in-person interviews. I met with a total of six people over 3+ hours; some individually, others in pairs. All were members of their senior executive staff. The interviews went enough without anything too negative; nor did I stumble badly over any of the topics we discussed. I was told that they had been interviewing a lot of people over the past several months.

I didn't hear anything back and called to follow up 7-10 days later. After leaving a VM with my HR contact she called me back the following day to let me know that I would not receive a job offer. The only feedback I received was that I apparently wasn't a "good fit with the rest of the team."
Interview Questions:
The questions were pretty straight-forward as they related to marketing strategy, tactics and social media. They are very much into social media avenues that specifically target potential Millennial and Generation Z students. 

I didn't find anything about the interview process particularly stressful or hard; in fact, I was confident about my ability to produce for them in all areas.

That said, this job has been posted and re-posted multiple times before / after my interviews. In my opinion they are seeking the mythical "Purple Squirrel" (i.e the PERFECT candidate who will check ALL the boxes that they want filled) who can hit the ground running with absolutely no training.

They apparently are going to keep searching until they find it.

title: Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vista College (Richardson, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Rushed and Unprofessional. One will be accepted quite quickly without effort; however, beware compensation is discussed at minimum. After paying for required documentation at one's own expense,  salary/pay process agreement is shared.  Misleading information. Adjuncts: this is a waste of money and time.
Interview Questions: Do you want to teach this class? Primary focus on student retention.

title: Leadership Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Vista College (Dallas, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Recruiter was very helpful and on top of things.  She did her homework as she knew a lot about the company and hiring manager.  I think the culture is more difficult than I originally thought.
Interview Questions: How to best address current employee issue?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Vista College
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview, then face to face. Nice job reeling you in. The experience really depends on dept head. There is no true process. If they are in need of an employee you will be persuaded easily.
Interview Questions: Why Texas?

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Vista College (College Station, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: You meet with the director of Admissions and she shows you a ppt explaining their mission, job description, and shares some success stories. Then, an admissions representative gives you a tour and asks you some questions about your customer service experience. Then, you go and meet the with Director of Vista college and he gives you more information about their business model.  Finally, you sit through a student interview and then watch them make some phone calls. The entire process took about two and a half hours. All the employees were nice, but I think it is a shady business. You are not an admissions representative as a call center employee.  you need to make 200 phone calls a day. Plus, their education is overpriced for the quality. Pretty unimpressed.
Interview Questions: Explain your customer service experience.

title: Admissions Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Vista College (Lubbock, TX) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Met with campus director and they asked what I was looking for salary wise. I told them, after researching the average salary, and they offered me over 20% below the national average.
Interview Questions: What type of salary are you looking for?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Vista College
Interview Descriptions: Briefly went over education and qualifications. Toured the facility and was informed how the programs worked. I realized during the interview that this would not be a long term contract. They were just desperate for help.
Interview Questions: Continuing education? Possibly in other fields.

title: Program Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vista College (College Station, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview and then a spur of the moment can you come in about 3 hours for an in person interview then take a test geared for sales and recruiting
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience

title: Campus President Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Vista College (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: they call it the gauntlet, all day starting at 9am you meet with each individual for 30 min to an hour different questions from each that pertains to their responsibility then around 2pm you meet your last interview with CEO and make sure you do not make a simple mistake in your question because as it should be I guess even after all 10 people you interview with like you and want you if you miss word your questions to the CEO you will not get hired
Interview Questions: typical

title: The Found My Resume On A Career Site Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vista College (College Station, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: He phoned me at my home and discussed my resume.  He asked me if I wanted to teach a class. Talked about making a contract.  Showed me the course syllabus .   Asked me to do a 5 minute lesson.
Interview Questions: Do you want to teach this class or that class?  Have you ever taught this before?  Let's look at your resume.  How would you teach this class if you had to?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Vista College in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I walked in, handed the director my resume, and was hired. It was the easiest interview of my entire life. I cannot express how easy it was to get the job at Vista College.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Vista College (Longview, TX) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was asked a lot of questions about how I would teach and work with students and very little about subject matter knowledge. The initial interview was done over the phone and probably lasted about an hour. I then had another in person interview which focused on what I could bring to the table. I did a mock teaching session after being hired.
Interview Questions: It probably had to do with how I would deal with challenging students.
